rows.text: British forces have been using the no. 23 as their standard grenade since 1902.
The rearmament of the German army is also based on this impressive new development from the Steiner plant.
When it comes to explosive power, this ultra-modern American fragmentation grenade is way ahead of the competition.
A novel Red Army stick grenade - probably smuggled into the region through the Caucasus.
High explosive - when strong language just isn’t enough...
"Revive your spirits with a pinch of Sapristi snuff!"
"To my beloved Albert, yours eternally, Magda"
A neat bundle of paper sheets. Used as currency around the world.
A pile of valuable looking coins.
Can be used as car fuel. Apparently.
Use it to fill up your jeep's tank!
A random stash of adventurer's supplies. Required to use Medkits, Repairkits and Grenades.
A random stash of adventurer's supplies. Required to use Medkits, Repairkits and Grenades.
A strange green crystal of unknown origin. Known to the ancient egyptians as Ka, the mystical life-giver. Reportedly used by German scientists to unleash the powers of ancient artifacts.
This ammo is going to last a while.
Enough to reload your average magazine.
I'm sure it'll work just as reliably as ammo.
Emergency measures for when every second counts.
Traditionally, Serqet was the patron goddess of healers.
"Holy Hathor, Mother Goddess! You alone grant Solace to the Wretched."
The cult of Khuttoora was known in antiquity for the miracles wrought by its wandering priestesses.
You have to improvise to succeed in life.
When needle and thread just aren't enough!
Smoothes out even the most serious damage.
The High Hawk Priest Nerkut-Nir was tasked with the eternal preservation of the cult’s sacred artifacts.
Nefri-Ka-Hor was the founder of an alchemical tradition dedicated to the preservation of matter.
The local nomads tell incredible tales about the miraculous effects of this resinous-smelling balm.
An ancient tome full of cabbalistic charts and symbols.
An old round shield with a surface of polished copper.
This crude stone figure with its strangely elongated facial features doesn‘t seem to belong to any known human culture.
Seven papyrus scrolls, almost decayed and painted all over with faded hieroglyphs.
An enigmatic device, roughly one foot long and made out of a strangely gleaming steel alloy.
A warmely pulsating gem stone, jet-black and polished.
The legendary votive crown of the hapless kings of Kush.
One of the eleven fabulous emerald scarabs from the sunken desert city of Kharga Serabit.
According to its inscription, this is the death mask of Alexander the Great, one of the greatest conquerors of human history.
The Greek explorer Herodotus recorded his travels in the Middle East in this forgotten travelogue.
The Book of Treasures is an ancient collection of myths. It contains insightful passages about the lost treasures of the Arabian Peninsula.
According to legend, this is the sword that Genghis Khan used to execute the rulers of the peoples he conquered.
The walking stick of the enlightened Rabbi Isaac Luria. The carved ivory lion's head can be unscrewed. A small cavity contains a carefully folded piece of paper with a cabbalistic number puzzle.
It appears to be about the deployment plans for Research Battalion South.
The contents appear to be a speculative design of a capacitor brain.
Could this be the prototype blueprint for a Valkyrium machine?
Simply holding this amulet of the protective goddess seems to heighten your senses
The ring gives off an aura of profound evil.
Two blood red rubies are sewn into the sunken eye holes!
You don’t think those wires are supposed to be sticking out of the side flap.
The latest development from the historic British manufacturer Frobisher & Boyd. It‘s clearly still a work in progress, but it should be safe to use - for the most part, anyway...
The latest development from the historic British manufacturer Frobisher & Boyd. It‘s clearly still a work in progress, but it should be safe to use - for the most part, anyway...
This thing is making some worrying noises.
This design is obviously a work in progress. Those crazy Germans and their mysterious prototypes!
This design is obviously a work in progress. Those crazy Germans and their mysterious prototypes!
It’s a little complicated to use, but otherwise perfect!
Some of the screws have come loose.
The Americans have entered the highly competitive disintegrator market with this mass-produced model.
The Americans have entered the highly competitive disintegrator market with this mass-produced model.
It appears to be a brand new model.
It smells like it’s been wrapped in smelly rags.
A new approach by the mysterious Eastern Europeans. You wonder what Vril is and why it needs burning.
A new approach by the mysterious Eastern Europeans. You wonder what Vril is and why it needs burning.
It appears to have taken a few knocks during transport.
Predictably excellent German engineering from the enigmatic weapons foundry in Xanten.
Predictably excellent German engineering from the enigmatic weapons foundry in Xanten.
Lights flicker on and off at random...
The Ritterwerck Planckstrahler is a truly awe-inspiring weapon.
The Ritterwerck Planckstrahler is a truly awe-inspiring weapon.
You can hear something rattling inside the weapon...
The Beam Rifle SG35 - the latest technology for the German Reich’s deadly Teslaborgs!
The Beam Rifle SG35 - the latest technology for the German Reich’s deadly Teslaborgs!
The weapon sits very comfortably in your hand!
The weapon smells like it may have had a short circuit.
Easy to use, robust and mercilessly efficient: The Verne Gun is a true masterpiece from the Oakfield workshops
Easy to use, robust and mercilessly efficient: The Verne Gun is a true masterpiece from the Oakfield workshops
This was probably a custom order.
The blade is almost completely dull.
It doesn’t even have a corkscrew.
It doesn’t even have a corkscrew.
Hey, it even has a corkscrew!
It's as sharp as a razor!
The blade is a little loose.
It must have been lying around for years.
A little heavy, but it fits well in your hand.
A little heavy, but it fits well in your hand.
It looks like it's fresh from the kitchen.
This weapon has seen better days.
The standard weapon of the dreaded Ghurka warriors: agile and deadly.
The standard weapon of the dreaded Ghurka warriors: agile and deadly.
A Malayan bush knife. The perfect weapon for jungle warfare!
A Malayan bush knife. The perfect weapon for jungle warfare!
The blade has a nice heft to it.
Unfortunately the tip of the blade has broken off.
A relic of the trench warfare of the Great War.
A relic of the trench warfare of the Great War.
This knife has been lovingly maintained!
This pistol has lived a long and eventful life.
This has been the the standard weapon of British field medics since 1915.
This has been the the standard weapon of British field medics since 1915.
A German classic, proven a thousand times in the trenches of Flanders.
A German classic, proven a thousand times in the trenches of Flanders.
This weapon was lovingly maintained by its previous owner.
This gun has been lying in the desert sand.
The German officer corps is currently being outfitted with this state-of-the-art weapon.
The German officer corps is currently being outfitted with this state-of-the-art weapon.
It's like it has never been used.
It’s a bit old, but still in a class of its own: The Breton Neuvelle 9mm!
It’s a bit old, but still in a class of its own: The Breton Neuvelle 9mm!
This weapon is inscribed with a motto: 'Si vis pacem para bellum'. You’re sure it means something very clever.
This weapon is inscribed with a motto: 'Si vis pacem para bellum' You’re sure it means something very clever.
Someone has used an oily rag to keep it shiny and well maintained.
Unfortunately, it’s no longer in very good shape.
When you really want the first shot to count - the MB Magnum redefines stopping power!
When you really want the first shot to count - the MB Magnum redefines stopping power!
This short-barreled yet powerful revolver is particularly popular with Scotland Yard detectives.
This short-barreled yet powerful revolver is particularly popular with Scotland Yard detectives.
This revolver is in excellent condition!
Something is wrong with the front sight...
Thanks to its unprecedented firepower, the American Charleston .357 is a global hit!
Thanks to its unprecedented firepower, the American Charleston .357 is a global hit!
The barrel is a little deformed.
Robust and affordable - this has been the design philosophy of the Alsatian Venner plants since 1878.
Robust and affordable - this has been the design philosophy of the Alsatian Venner plants since 1878.
The grips on the rifle butt have come loose.
Amazingly light for this caliber. Another example of German engineering. A disturbing harbinger of the future of warfare.
Amazingly light for this caliber. Another example of German engineering. A disturbing harbinger of the future of warfare.
Someone has tried to scrape away the rust stains on the barrel using desert sand.
A late German development from the Great War. Maximum mobility in trench fighting thanks to a radically shortened barrel.
A late German development from the Great War. Maximum mobility in trench fighting thanks to a radically shortened barrel.
This carbine has been well maintained.
A sharp impact has cracked the wood of the rifle butt.
An impressive new development from the turbulent post-war years, designed to meet the needs of British colonial troops.
An impressive new development from the turbulent post-war years, designed to meet the needs of British colonial troops.
It still smells a little of wood shavings. It’s probably straight from the crate.
The trigger feels a little loose.
The Charleston M1 is now considered the standard weapon of the US Federal Police in their battle against heavily armed bootleggers and the mafia.
The Charleston M1 is now considered the standard weapon of the US Federal Police in their battle against heavily armed bootleggers and the mafia.
This weapon has a history, and you can tell!
The doughboys of the American Expeditionary Force brought the M1917 with them across the Atlantic. Some call it the gun that won the Great War.
The doughboys of the American Expeditionary Force brought the M1917 with them across the Atlantic. Some call it the gun that won the Great War.
Presumably a post-war model that never saw action on the front line.
The weapon appears to be faulty.
The SF-31D is a more compact evolution of existing weapon technologies.
The SF-31D is a more compact evolution of existing weapon technologies.
You think this weapon belonged to a German officer.
The drum magazine is a bit loose!
The Dominic’s drum magazine allows for an impressive rate of fire.
The Dominic’s drum magazine allows for an impressive rate of fire.
The shotgun barrel is dented in several places.
With its simple smoothbore design, the Charleston mainly serves the domestic hunting market.
With its simple smoothbore design, the Charleston mainly serves the domestic hunting market.
This shotgun is in perfect condition.
The breech is covered with powder marks.
With it’s break action model, this is Morley-Burke‘s medium-bracket hunting shotgun.
With it’s break action model, this is Morley-Burke‘s medium-bracket hunting shotgun.
The gun looks like it has never been fired.
When you look closely, you see some fine hairline cracks in the barrel...
The Venner Buckshot: when you want to pack a punch.
The Venner Buckshot: when you want to pack a punch.
Despite its weight, it is surprisingly well balanced!
The gun looks like it has been used as a club more than once.
A British development of previous civilian models. It caused fear and mayhem in the trench combat of the Great War.
A British development of previous civilian models. It caused fear and mayhem in the trench combat of the Great War.
Robust and efficient, the Klugenstein HS is ideal for stalking and other activities.
Robust and efficient, the Klugenstein HS is ideal for stalking and other activities.
It fits well in the hand, like a natural extension of your arm...
This gun is in a dismal condition!
Scottish hunting tradition since 1721 - the Willoughby family business guarantees quality and performance.
Scottish hunting tradition since 1721 - the Willoughby family business guarantees quality and performance.
The breech is a little stiff.
Originally developed for wolf hunting, the Lupara inflicts devastating injuries at short range.
Originally developed for wolf hunting, the Lupara inflicts devastating injuries at short range.
You can see that this is an old weapon.
The Gordon Riot Gun - especially developed for tactical combat in rough terrain!
The Gordon Riot Gun - especially developed for tactical combat in rough terrain!
Someone should tighten the screws on this thing.
The 8x56 is an affordable gun for hunting and related activities.
The 8x56 is an affordable gun for hunting and related activities.
The standard weapon of British snipers in the Great War.
The standard weapon of British snipers in the Great War.
The rifle is lighter than expected.
The desert sand has not been kind to this rifle’s mechanism.
The .303 Ghillie is a classic Scottish highland hunting rifle from the long-established Willoughby company.
The .303 Ghillie is a classic Scottish highland hunting rifle from the long-established Willoughby company.
Unfortunately, it is not very well preserved.
A state-of-the-art development from British army supplier Hastings that balances caliber and recoil.
A state-of-the-art development from British army supplier Hastings that balances caliber and recoil.
Probably freshly pilfered from British army supplies.
A weapon like this deserves better care...
American engineers developed the Clark-Richfield in the final months of the Great War to counter German snipers. However, it was too late to see action on the front.
American engineers developed the Clark-Richfield in the final months of the Great War to counter German snipers. However, it was too late to see action on the front.
A shining example of American craftsmanship!
This rifle looks like it spent several years lying in a Flemish trench!
The legendary weapon of the German snipers on the killing fields of the Great War 1914 - 1918.
The legendary weapon of the German snipers on the killing fields of the Great War 1914 - 1918.
The scope really is in a class of its own!
It’s incredible that the weapon still shoots...
The Hericault Lunette is the sniper rifle of the French Foreign Legion.
The Hericault Lunette is the sniper rifle of the French Foreign Legion.
Unfortunately, the desert sand has scratched the scope!
State-of-the-art and equipped with the best optics - the Zeisig ZF-32!
State-of-the-art and equipped with the best optics - the Zeisig ZF-32!
Slightly battered, but still very impressive!
You can't believe such advanced technology actually exists...
You can't believe such advanced technology actually exists...
The dull, blackened steel fittings seem to be a special design.
Oil has leaked out at the shoulder joints.
Massive and awe-inspiring - a true titan of the battlefield!
Massive and awe-inspiring - a true titan of the battlefield!
Something is engraved into the steel breastplate: 'DAUNTLESS'.
